main event: A USAF Meteorological reconnaissance aircraft crew observed a bright light moving rapidly across their field of view over the Pacific Ocean near Johnston Island on December 16, 1965.
interesting points: The light was estimated to be 20 miles distant and at 20,000 feet above the aircraft,The crew observed the light for approximately 30 seconds before it disappeared,The crew believed the light appeared to be under intelligent control,The sighting raised questions about unidentified aerial phenomena activity in the area,The document is from Project Blue Book, a historical U.S. Air Force program.
witness description: crew of a USAF meteorological reconnaissance aircraft
